title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, cut guanciale into small strips and cook in a pan over medium heat until crispy. Remove guanciale, leaving rendered fat in the pan.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, grated Pecorino Romano, and a generous amount of black pepper.
Drain spaghetti, reserving some pasta water. Add hot spaghetti to the pan with guanciale fat. Toss quickly.

Pour egg mixture over the pasta, tossing vigorously to coat. Add a splash of reserved pasta water if needed to create a creamy sauce. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs without scrambling them.
Stir in crispy guanciale. Serve immediately with extra Pecorino and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 500g boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into cubes
instructions: Marinate chicken: In a bowl, combine chicken, yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, cumin, coriander, turmeric, chili powder, and half of the garam masala. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight in the fridge.
Cook chicken: Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken from pan and set aside.

Make sauce: In the same pan, add chopped onion and cook until softened. Add remaining ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute. Stir in crushed tomatoes, the rest of the garam masala, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in cooked chicken and heavy cream. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until sauce thickens. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir-fry
summary: A quick and healthy dish packed with fresh vegetables and a savory sauce.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, snap peas)
instructions: Prepare sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), rice vinegar, sesame oil, and sugar. In another small bowl, mix cornstarch with water to create a slurry.
Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Pour the sauce mixture over the vegetables. Stir well. Add the cornstarch slurry and stir constantly until the sauce thickens.
Serve immediately with rice or noodles.
